marketNews.title: The Fed Still Projects 3 Interest Rate Cuts in 2024
marketNews.content: The Fed decided to hold the benchmark interest rate in the range of 5.25-5.5% in the meeting on Wednesday (20/3) local time, in line with consensus expectations. In the meeting, Fed officials still projected an interest rate cut of 75 bps throughout 2024. This projection has not changed from the projection made in December 2023. Assuming each cut is 25 bps, the Fed will cut rates 3 times in 2024. However, the Head of the Fed, Jerome Powell, said that they would be more cautious because US inflation data at the beginning of 2024 still exceeded consensus expectations. Powell also mentioned that the timing of the rate cut would depend on further economic data. On Thursday (21/3), probability analysis from the CME FedWatch Tool showed that the market expects the Fed's interest rate cut to start in June 2024, with a probability reaching 67.4%. This probability increased compared to 65.6% on March 13, 2024. Following the Fed's announcement, the three main US indices strengthened on Wednesday (20/3), with Dow Jones +1.03%, S&P 500 +0.88%, and Nasdaq +1.25%. Meanwhile, the US dollar index (DXY) fell -0.18% to the level of 103.2. On the same day, the 10-year US government bond yield fell approximately -10 bps to the level of 4.26%. Positive sentiment also occurred in gold, which strengthened by +1.2% to the level of 2,204.02 US dollars per ounce.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Positive signals regarding the potential for interest rate cuts by the Fed open room for interest rate cuts by Bank Indonesia. However, it is important to remember that there is still uncertainty regarding the timing and magnitude of the cuts. Interest rate cuts could potentially be a positive catalyst for several sectors, namely banking, property, technology, and gold. On Thursday (21/3), the IHSG strengthened +0.1%, with the finance sector +0.45%, property +1.11%, and technology +0.91%.

marketNews.title: General Market & Political Updates
marketNews.content: The General Election Commission established the Prabowo Subianto-Gibran Rakabuming Raka pair as the winners in the 2024 presidential election, after obtaining almost 58.6% of the national valid votes. The inauguration is scheduled to take place on October 20, 2024. Bloomberg noted that the Indonesian bond market experienced a foreign outflow of 1.1 billion US dollars since the election voting on February 14, 2024. Strategist at Goldman Sachs, Danny Suwanapruti, said that this trend was driven by investor concerns over potential fiscal easing by the new government which promised a free lunch program during the campaign, but without details on how the program would be financed. The Swiss central bank decided to cut its benchmark interest rate by 25 bps to the level of 1.5%, exceeding consensus expectations which predicted the rate would be held steady. This move also marks the first central bank to ease its interest rate policy. This decision was made following the reported inflation rate falling to 1.2% in February 2023.

tickerNews.title: NCKL: Glencore and Itochu Eying Strategic Investor Roles
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg reported that Glencore Plc. and Itochu Corporation are among the strategic investor candidates for Trimegah Bangun Persada. Previously, NCKL shareholders on Friday (15/3) had approved the plan for a rights issue of up to 18.93 billion (30%) new shares. NCKL management told Stockbit on Wednesday (28/2) that the company had 3 strategic investor candidates, consisting of a commodity company from Europe, a company from Asia (outside China), and an Indonesian business group.

tickerNews.title: UNTR: Heavy Equipment Sales and Mining Contractor Performance as of February 2024
tickerNews.content: United Tractors recorded sales of 307 units of Komatsu heavy equipment in February 2024 (-40.7% MoM, -43.8% YoY). For 2M24, Komatsu sales fell -33% YoY to 825 units, with market share also dropping to 30% (vs. 2M23: 34%). From the mining contractor segment, UNTR recorded coal production volume of 20.5 million tons in 2M24 (+19.2% YoY), with overburden removal at 183.8 million bcm (+15.1% YoY).

tickerNews.title: HRTA: Targeting Rp 10 Trillion in Jewelry Exports and Expanding Retail Network
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Hartadinata Abadi, Sandra Sunanto, stated that the company is targeting gold jewelry exports of IDR 10 trillion during 2024, an increase of up to +132.5-138% from the estimated 2023 export value which we forecast at the level of IDR 4.2-4.3 trillion. HRTA plans to expand to export markets in Singapore, Vietnam, the US, and Europe. In 2023, HRTA only exported to India and the United Arab Emirates. Sandra mentioned that the company targets a net profit growth of +15% YoY in 2024, with a revenue target growing +30% YoY. The company allocated a capex of IDR 60 billion in 2024, which is intended to add 20 new outlets, bringing the total number of outlets to 103 units.

tickerNews.title: AKRA: 2023 Net Profit Reached Rp 2.78 Trillion Driven by Industrial Property Margin Growth
tickerNews.content: AKR Corporindo recorded a net profit of IDR 2.78 trillion (+15.7% YoY) in 2023, equivalent to 106.5% of consensus estimates. This result was supported by the growth of the industrial property segment in JIIPE (+103% YoY) to IDR 2.32 trillion, while total revenue decreased -11.5% YoY to IDR 42.1 trillion. The industrial property segment itself has a larger margin compared to fuel trading and chemical distribution, so it succeeded in pushing the gross profit margin up to 10.6% (vs. 2022: 8.9%). During 2023, the industrial property segment recorded land sales of 91 hectares, equivalent to 121% of the 2023 target. In 4Q23, AKRA recorded a net profit of IDR 1.1 trillion (+62% QoQ, +28.9% YoY). In 2024, AKRA targets JIIPE land sales to grow +42.9% YoY to 130 hectares.

tickerNews.title: CNMA: Management Guides for 2023 Dividend Payout of Rp 660 Billion
tickerNews.content: The management of Nusantara Sejahtera Raya, the operator of the XXI cinema network, provided guidance to distribute dividends for the 2023 fiscal year amounting to IDR 660 billion or approximately IDR 7.9 rupiah per share. This amount implies a 96% dividend payout ratio (DPR), higher than the guidance in the IPO prospectus at 35%. This plan will be discussed in the upcoming GMS. Based on CNMA's stock price at the market close on Thursday (21/3) at 222 rupiah per share, the indicated dividend yield is approximately 3.5%.

tickerNews.title: AVIA: Targeting 6-10% Revenue Growth in 2024 Supported by Distribution Network
tickerNews.content: Head of Investor Relations Avia Avian, Andreas Timothy Hadikrisno, stated that the company targets revenue growth of +6-10% YoY in 2024. This target will be supported by an increasingly complete product portfolio and a wide distribution network. As of the end of 2023, AVIA had 118 self-owned distribution centers, 14 mini distribution centers, and 40 third-party distribution centers. In 2024, AVIA allocated a capex of IDR 450 billion for the construction of a new plant in Cirebon with a capacity of 225,000 tons per year.

tickerNews.title: ENRG Shareholder Sells 45.75 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: The shareholder of Energi Mega Persada (ENRG), PT Shima Global Kapital, sold 45.75 million ENRG shares on March 19, 2024. This transaction was only recorded in KSEI data, so the selling price is not yet known. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Shima Global Kapital in ENRG decreased from 14.10% to 13.91%.
